definitions.text: the position of a prominent or well-known object in a particular landscape
examples: the church steeple provided a convenient landmark

definitions.text: an event marking a unique or important historical change of course or one on which important developments depend
examples: the agreement was a watershed in the history of both nations

definitions.text: a mark showing the boundary of a piece of land
an anatomical structure used as a point of origin in locating other anatomical structures (as in surgery) or as point from which measurements can be taken
